title: How Many Calories in Sirloin Steak?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in sirloin steak, including protein, fat, full nutrition breakdown per serving, and easy tweaks for different preparations.
h1: How Many Calories in Sirloin Steak?
assumptions: Lean top sirloin steak, trimmed to 0" fat, cooked (broiled), standard 150 g serving size.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat content, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels or use a food scale for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One 150 g cooked sirloin steak has ~309 kcal and ~45 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp butter for cooking per steak
Include 1/4 inch fat trim (vs. lean) per 100 g
Grilled with 1 tsp olive oil per steak

faqs.q: How many calories in one sirloin steak?
faqs.a: About 309 kcal for a 150 g lean, cooked sirloin steak.

faqs.q: What's the protein in sirloin steak?
faqs.a: Roughly 30 g protein per 100 g, or 45 g per 150 g steak.
No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain cooked sirloin steak.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in sirloin steak?
faqs.a: Broiling or grilling keeps it lean; frying or adding fats increases calories by 30-50 kcal per serving.

faqs.q: Is sirloin steak high in fat?
faqs.a: Lean cuts have ~8.6 g fat per 100 g; choose trimmed for lower fat.
